message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper deals with natural language processing and machine learning techniques for estimating the distributed representation of words. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes a new model for estimating distributional representations of words, which involves clustering occurrences of multi-sense words. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper evaluates its proposed model on the contextual word similarity task, which is a common evaluation task in the field of information retrieval (cs.IR). Finally, the paper uses a loss-driven approach to estimate the distributed representation of multi-sense words, which may also be relevant to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
